approvalHistory.comments: Financials reviewed and verified. All figures reconciled. Revenue recognised at ZMW 3,850,000,000 in line with ERB-approved tariff schedule.
No material issues found. Minor disclosure improvements recommended on related-party transactions. Actioned by management.
Committee satisfied with financial statements and audit findings from PwC. Recommended for full board adoption.
Board approved FY2024 financial statements unanimously. Net loss of ZMW 210,000,000 noted; management directed to prioritise tariff rationalisation.
Audited financial statements submitted to Ministry of Energy with board approval resolution and covering letter.
Ministry acknowledges receipt and approves FY2024 financial statements. Copy forwarded to ERB and Ministry of Finance as required.
Interim dividend of ZMW 85,000,000 calculated, representing 30% of H1 2024 after-tax profit per MoF-DIR-2023-018. Cash flow adequacy confirmed post-payment.
CEO endorses dividend proposal. Confirms ZESCO liquidity position is adequate and BoZ has no objection.
Board approves interim dividend of ZMW 85,000,000. Payment to be processed upon Ministry of Finance notification and acknowledgement.
Notification letter submitted to Ministry of Finance on 10 February 2025. Awaiting acknowledgement before processing payment.
FY2025 departmental budgets consolidated. Total operating budget ZMW 4,200,000,000. Capital expenditure ZMW 890,000,000 for transmission upgrades and smart metering rollout.
Budget reviewed and aligned with ZESCO 5-year strategic plan. Variance analysis against FY2024 actuals reviewed. Revenue projections based on ERB tariff review outcome.
CEO approves budget for board presentation. Capital expenditure phasing reviewed to reflect AMI procurement schedule.
Finance Committee reviewed budget in detail. Recommends approval with minor reduction to administration overheads. Management to revert with revised figures.
Board approved FY2025 budget of ZMW 4,200,000,000 subject to Ministry of Energy concurrence. Revised admin overheads confirmed.
Ministry of Energy approves ZESCO FY2025 budget. Budget circular issued to all business units effective 1 December 2024.
Q3 2024 internal audit report finalised. 3 high-risk findings (procurement controls and IT access management) and 8 medium-risk findings identified. Management responses and action plans attached.
Management responses reviewed and updated. Action owners and implementation timelines confirmed for all high-risk findings.
Report scheduled for presentation at Board Audit Committee meeting on 15 November 2024.
Procurement evaluation completed for AMI smart meters. Recommended supplier: Landis+Gyr Zambia at ZMW 287,000,000 for 500,000 units. Three bidders evaluated.
Contract value within approved budget allocation of ZMW 310,000,000. Payment terms: 30% advance, 60% on delivery, 10% on commissioning. Recommend approval.
CEO approves contract for Board consideration. ZMW 287,000,000 value exceeds CEO approval authority threshold of ZMW 100,000,000.
Contract tabled for Board approval at December 2024 Board meeting.
Technical feasibility confirmed for Kafue Gorge Lower 750 MW extension. Engineering specifications and hydrological assessments reviewed and approved.
NPV of ZMW 2,100,000,000 confirmed over 25-year project life. Financing structure: 70% concessional debt (AfDB/World Bank), 30% GRZ equity injection. IRR of 14.2%.
Investment strategically critical for national energy security and aligns with Zambia 8,000 MW generation target. CEO recommends board approval.
Board unanimously approves investment. Total capital commitment of ZMW 8,400,000,000 authorised subject to Ministry of Energy and Ministry of Finance concurrence.
Ministry of Energy approves Kafue Gorge Lower extension investment. GRZ equity injection of ZMW 2,520,000,000 confirmed in 2024 MTEF. EPC tender to proceed.
Annual ERB licence compliance self-assessment completed. 42 of 45 licence conditions fully compliant. Three conditions partially compliant with documented remediation plans and timelines.
Financial compliance conditions verified: tariff reporting, financial disclosure, and ring-fenced accounts all confirmed compliant.
Committee reviewed compliance report and is satisfied with management remediation plans for the three partial compliance items.
ERB acknowledges receipt of annual compliance report. ZESCO operating licence in good standing. Next scheduled review April 2025.
FY2023 consolidated financial statements reviewed. Portfolio valuation, equity accounting, and revenue recognition consistent with prior year. Total assets ZMW 3,500,000,000.
Intercompany elimination schedule verified. Two minor misclassifications between operating and capital expenditure corrected.
Audit Committee satisfied with financial statements and Ernst and Young audit findings. Recommended for full board adoption.
IDC Board adopted FY2023 financial statements. Net profit ZMW 215,000,000. Dividend resolution of ZMW 64,500,000 to GRZ approved separately.
Ministry of Finance acknowledges receipt of IDC FY2023 audited financial statements. Submitted within 90-day statutory requirement. Forwarded to State Audit Office.
Due diligence on proposed ZMW 180,000,000 stake acquisition in Zambia Agro-Processing Limited completed. Financial health, market position, and management team assessed as satisfactory.
Financial model reviewed. IRR of 18% over 10 years. Acquisition price at 8x EBITDA in line with comparable transactions. Funding from IDC internal reserves.
Investment aligned with IDC agro-industrialisation pillar. Job creation impact: approximately 1,200 direct jobs. CEO endorses for Board Investment Committee.
Board Investment Committee approves investment subject to GRZ shareholder concurrence. Management directed to proceed to Ministry of Finance.
Submission made to Ministry of Finance on 12 December 2024. Awaiting GRZ shareholder concurrence letter.
FY2023 dividend calculated at ZMW 64,500,000 (30% of after-tax profit of ZMW 215,000,000 per MoF-DIR-2023-018). Verified against audited accounts and EY audit report.
CEO endorses dividend distribution. IDC liquidity position confirmed adequate post-payment. Investment pipeline capacity maintained.
Board approves FY2023 dividend of ZMW 64,500,000 for remittance to GRZ. Payment to be completed by 30 September 2024 per directive requirements.
Ministry of Finance acknowledges dividend notification. Bank account details for GRZ consolidated fund confirmed.
Dividend of ZMW 64,500,000 successfully transferred to GRZ consolidated fund. Bank reference: IDC-DIV-FY2023-001. Receipt confirmed from Ministry of Finance.

Board resolution on Maamba Collieries divestiture drafted. Resolution authorises management to engage transaction advisors and initiate a competitive sale process per MoF-DIR-2024-005 portfolio rationalisation requirements.

Resolution text reviewed. Consistent with IDC Act, Companies Act 2017, and Ministry of Finance shareholder instructions. Environmental liability provision added as a pre-condition to transfer of title.
On hold pending completion of independent asset valuation by Grant Thornton. Valuation report expected December 2024. CEO review and board presentation to resume upon receipt.

GRI Standards-aligned ESG reporting framework developed. Materiality assessment completed with 12 material topics identified. Data collection templates distributed to all subsidiaries and portfolio companies.
Framework and data quality controls reviewed. Recommend third-party assurance for Scope 1 and 2 GHG emissions data. SECZAM submission deadline 30 April 2025 is achievable.
Awaiting CEO approval of ESG framework before SECZAM submission. Scheduled for January 2025 Executive Management Committee meeting.
Corporate and subsidiary budgets consolidated. FY2025 total budget: ZMW 620,000,000 operating, ZMW 340,000,000 new investment pipeline. Three new agro-processing investments included.
Budget aligned with IDC Strategic Plan 2023-2027. Investment allocations reviewed for portfolio fit and return-on-investment targets. Dividend provision of ZMW 65,000,000 included.
CEO approves budget for board presentation. Agro-processing and manufacturing sectors prioritised per GRZ industrialisation agenda.
Finance Committee recommends approval. Requests monthly budget variance reports and quarterly investment performance updates.
Board approves FY2025 budget. Capital investment authority of ZMW 340,000,000 granted. GRZ equity contribution of ZMW 50,000,000 noted as pending confirmation.
Ministry of Finance approves IDC FY2025 budget. GRZ equity contribution of ZMW 50,000,000 confirmed in supplementary budget. SOE budget submission complete.

RFP evaluation complete for portfolio strategy consulting. Recommended: McKinsey and Company at ZMW 12,500,000 for 6-month engagement. Three proposals evaluated; McKinsey ranked highest on methodology and Zambia experience.
Contract value within CFO approval threshold of ZMW 15,000,000. Budget provision confirmed in FY2024 operating budget. Payment milestones aligned to deliverables.
CEO approves engagement. Contract signed 10 June 2024. Work commenced 15 June 2024 with final portfolio strategy report due September 2024.
FY2024 financial statements prepared. Total assets ZMW 18,200,000,000. Net profit ZMW 420,000,000. IFRS 9 ECL provisions of ZMW 680,000,000 reviewed and validated against loan book.
Revenue recognition and IFRS 9 ECL provisioning methodology confirmed consistent with BoZ guidelines. No material adjustments required.
Audit Committee reviewed FY2024 statements jointly with Deloitte external auditors. Unqualified audit opinion confirmed. Recommend full board adoption.
Financial statements tabled for ZANACO Board approval at the 10 February 2025 board meeting.

Annual AML/CFT programme assessment completed per BoZ-DIR-2023-019. 24 programme elements assessed. Three elements required enhancement: STR quality, PEP customer due diligence, and staff training completion rates.
Enhancement programme implemented. Transaction monitoring system upgraded. PEP screening integrated with Refinitiv World-Check. Staff training completion rate improved to 96%.
CEO endorses AML/CFT programme enhancements. Confirms executive commitment to compliance culture and adequate resourcing for compliance function.
Board approves annual AML/CFT compliance report and enhancement programme. Annual report submitted to Bank of Zambia on 30 March 2024 as required.

rejectionReason: Proposed FY2025 capital expenditure budget of ZMW 890,000,000 exceeded board-approved parameters by 45%. Board Finance Committee rejected the submission and directed management to revise with a minimum 30% reduction in non-critical technology capital expenditure and resubmit with detailed ROI justification by 15 November 2024.

approvalHistory.comments: Departmental budget submissions consolidated. Total FY2025 budget: ZMW 2,340,000,000 operating costs plus ZMW 890,000,000 capital expenditure for digital transformation platform and 25-branch network expansion.
Budget reviewed and submitted for Board consideration. Technology investment reflects requirements of 5-year digital strategy. ROI projected at 19% over 5 years.

REJECTED. Capex of ZMW 890,000,000 exceeds board-approved parameters by 45%. Detailed ROI analysis insufficient for the digital platform component. Management directed to apply a minimum 30% capex reduction and resubmit with strengthened business case by 15 November 2024.

RFP evaluation complete for Core Banking System upgrade. Temenos T24 selected at ZMW 156,000,000 over a 5-year contract. Scored highest on functionality, regional implementation track record, and local support capacity.
IT Steering Committee endorses Temenos T24 selection. Enterprise architecture review completed. Data migration and parallel-run risk assessment reviewed; mitigations agreed and documented.
ZMW 156,000,000 within approved IT capital budget. Board approval required as contract value exceeds ZMW 100,000,000 threshold.
CEO approves and forwards to Board. Core banking modernisation is foundational to digital transformation strategy. Implementation partner accountability provisions confirmed in contract.
Board approves Temenos T24 5-year contract at ZMW 156,000,000. Implementation programme to commence June 2024 with go-live targeted Q1 2026.
H1 2024 interim dividend calculated at ZMW 105,000,000 (25% of H1 after-tax profit). CAR remains above 12% at 13.8% post-payment. BoZ pre-approval notification submitted.
CEO endorses interim dividend. BoZ has acknowledged pre-approval notification. Shareholder will receive ZMW 105,000,000 representing healthy return on GRZ equity stake.
Dividend resolution tabled for Special Board Meeting scheduled 5 September 2024. Quorum confirmed.

Deloitte Zambia engaged as external auditors for FY2023. Audit engagement letter signed. Audit plan including emphasis on IFRS 9 ECL and digital banking revenue recognition reviewed by Audit Committee.
Management representation letter signed. All audit queries resolved. No material misstatements identified. Deloitte confirmed unqualified audit opinion with emphasis of matter on IFRS 9 transition.
Audit Committee reviewed FY2023 audited statements and discussed findings directly with Deloitte. Satisfied with audit quality and independence. Recommends full board adoption.
Board adopts FY2023 audited financial statements. Total assets ZMW 16,800,000,000, net profit ZMW 385,000,000. Annual report to be published and submitted to BoZ by 31 March 2024.

Feasibility study for 12 new branch openings in underserved provinces (North-Western, Luapula, Muchinga, Western) completed. Total investment ZMW 42,000,000. Business case projects break-even by month 36 at target deposit volumes.
Financial model reviewed. ROI of 22% over 5 years. Capital allocation within approved FY2025 investment budget. Recommend board approval.
Branch expansion investment proposal tabled for Board consideration at November 2024 meeting. Decision pending board deliberations.

FY2024 draft financial statements prepared. Revenue ZMW 420,000,000 against budget ZMW 610,000,000 (31% shortfall). GRZ operating subsidy of ZMW 280,000,000 recognised. Infrastructure impairment of ZMW 180,000,000 applied.
Asset impairment methodology reviewed with KPMG external auditors. Revenue recognition for government freight contracts confirmed. Three minor disclosure corrections made.
Audit Committee review of FY2024 financial statements scheduled for 12 February 2025.

rejectionReason: Board rejected the Northern Corridor track upgrade investment proposal of ZMW 2,800,000,000 due to unconfirmed funding structure. Only ZMW 1,400,000,000 of the required amount was secured. Board directed management to obtain a signed AfDB concessional loan facility agreement before resubmitting.

approvalHistory.comments: Technical assessment of Northern Corridor upgrade completed. Scope: 312 km of track replacement (Lusaka-Chipata), 8 bridge rehabilitations, and 3 new passing loops. Engineering design at 30% completion. Estimated construction period 36 months.

Project NPV ZMW 1,200,000,000 over 30 years. Total cost ZMW 2,800,000,000. Funding gap of ZMW 1,400,000,000 identified. AfDB term sheet not yet finalised. GRZ equity injection verbally indicated but not confirmed in writing.

CEO endorses strategic importance of project for the Chipata-Zambia-Mozambique corridor. Notes funding gap risk but recommends board approval in principle pending AfDB facility confirmation within 90 days.

REJECTED. Board cannot approve ZMW 2,800,000,000 commitment without confirmed financing. ZR balance sheet cannot absorb ZMW 1,400,000,000 funding gap. Resubmit with signed AfDB facility agreement and revised financial model within 90 days of facility signing.

FY2025 departmental budgets consolidated. Total budget ZMW 780,000,000 including ZMW 320,000,000 rehabilitation capex (Phase 1 track works) and ZMW 240,000,000 GRZ operating subsidy assumption pending confirmation.
Revenue projections revised to ZMW 450,000,000 reflecting improved copper freight volumes. Cost optimisation measures targeting ZMW 35,000,000 savings identified in fuel and maintenance.
CEO approves budget for board consideration. GRZ operating subsidy assumption of ZMW 240,000,000 requires written confirmation from Ministry of Transport before finalisation.
Finance Committee endorses budget subject to GRZ subsidy confirmation. Directs management to obtain Ministry of Finance letter before full board meeting.
Awaiting Ministry of Finance letter confirming FY2025 operating subsidy of ZMW 240,000,000. Full Board meeting scheduled 20 November 2024.

RFP evaluation complete for 3-year locomotive preventive and corrective maintenance contract. General Electric (Zambia) selected at ZMW 58,000,000. Evaluation criteria: technical capability 40%, price 40%, local content 20%.

GE Zambia technical proposal reviewed. Preventive maintenance schedule, spare parts inventory commitments, and engineer qualifications confirmed. Technical score 87/100. Workshop facilities in Kabwe inspected.
Contract value of ZMW 58,000,000 within CFO approval limit for operational contracts. Budget provision confirmed in FY2024 maintenance opex. Monthly payments of ZMW 1,611,111 over 36 months.
CEO approves locomotive maintenance contract with GE Zambia. Contract signed 1 June 2024. Fleet availability target of 75% per month included as contractual KPI.

Independent safety auditor Railway Safety International (RSI) engaged per RTSA-DIR-2023-018. Audit scope covers mainline Livingstone-Kitwe, Mulobezi branch, and Chipata Corridor operations. Audit plan agreed with RTSA prior to commencement.

RSI safety audit completed 15 October 2023. Findings: 12 Category A (critical), 24 Category B (major), 37 Category C (minor). Management response with remediation plans, owners, and timelines submitted for each finding.
Board Audit Committee reviewed safety audit findings and remediation plan. Notes seriousness of Category A findings on track condition and level crossing safety. Monthly progress reporting mandated.

RTSA acknowledges receipt of safety audit report and management remediation plan. ZR operating certificate renewed for 12 months subject to monthly compliance reporting and Category A deficiency rectification.

Gap analysis against RTSA Safety Management System (SMS) requirements completed. Eight gaps identified: safety management plan, incident investigation procedures, competency assurance framework, fatigue management, and level crossing management plan.

SMS implementation plan developed with external safety consultant Transnet Engineering. Estimated cost ZMW 4,200,000. Implementation timeline 18 months. Three consultants to be embedded in ZR safety department.
On hold pending finalisation of updated RTSA SMS standards under public consultation through Q3 2024. Board presentation deferred to avoid rework should standards change materially.

Board resolution on Fleet Renewal Programme authority drafted. Resolution authorises CEO to execute AfDB loan facility agreement up to USD 85,000,000 for procurement of 15 mainline locomotives and 200 freight wagons per MoT-DIR-2024-009.

Resolution text reviewed. Consistent with ZR Act, Companies Act 2017, and Ministry of Transport mandate. GRZ sovereign guarantee provision included. Resolution structure confirms authority limits within ZR Articles.
CEO endorses resolution. AfDB financing terms finalised: USD 85,000,000 at 3.5% over 20 years with 5-year grace period. GRZ sovereign guarantee letter being prepared by Ministry of Finance.
Resolution tabled for Special Board Meeting scheduled 15 February 2025. GRZ guarantee letter expected before meeting date.
FY2023 final dividend of ZMW 0.58/share (ZMW 275,000,000 total) approved at AGM 28 May 2024. Payment due 28 June 2024.
Shareholder register confirmed. Dividend tax withholding computations reviewed. LuSE and AIM notifications prepared.
Chairman confirms dividend payment per AGM resolution. Dividend tax deduction at source at 15% for non-exempt shareholders.
Dividend payments processed via LuSE Central Securities Depository. GRZ received ZMW 213,125,000 (77.5% share). AIM investors paid in USD via Citibank London.
FY2024 draft financial statements prepared. Total revenue ZMW 6.35 billion, net profit ZMW 1.24 billion. Submitted to Ernst & Young for audit.
Audit Committee reviewed draft accounts. No material concerns raised. Mine rehabilitation provision confirmed adequate. EY audit in progress.
Ernst & Young Zambia conducting FY2024 audit. Final audit opinion expected by 31 March 2025.
Pending EY audit clearance. Scheduled for Board meeting 25 March 2025.
Nominations Committee recommends appointment of two independent non-executive directors to fill the Mining Technical and ESG skills gaps identified in the 2024 Board skills matrix assessment.

IDC as majority shareholder approves proposed director candidates per ZCCM-IH Articles of Association and IDC nomination rights. Candidates: Dr. Chola Kasonde (Mining Technical) and Ms. Lungowe Mwila (ESG).
Board approves appointment of Dr. Chola Kasonde and Ms. Lungowe Mwila as independent NEDs effective 15 December 2024.
LuSE and AIM regulatory announcements issued. PACRA director appointment notices filed. Director declarations of interest completed.
CEO proposes partial divestiture of ZCCM-IH's 5% stake in Chibuluma Mines Plc to fund cobalt refinery acquisition. Investment case prepared.
Investment Committee reviewed divestiture proposal. Supports partial disposal subject to regulatory and shareholder approval. Recommends engaging Ministry of Mines for pre-clearance.
Pre-clearance request submitted to Ministry of Mines and Minerals Development. Response expected Q1 2025.
Pending Ministry clearance. Board resolution and extraordinary shareholder approval required per ZCCM-IH Memorandum and Articles.
Updated mine rehabilitation plan prepared for all portfolio mines incorporating 2024 actuarial cost review, AMD remediation programme, and tailings facility updates.
Financial provisions reviewed and confirmed adequate. ZMW 3.8 billion rehabilitation fund balance validated. No additional provisioning required for FY2024.
Audit Committee endorsed updated rehabilitation plan and fund adequacy assessment.
Updated mine rehabilitation plan submitted to ZEMA per environmental licence conditions. ZEMA acknowledged receipt and will confirm review outcome within 60 days.
FY2023 financials reviewed and verified. Total revenue ZMW 2,450,000,000, net profit ZMW 270,000,000. Audited by Deloitte Zambia  clean opinion.
No material issues identified. Minor disclosure improvements made on related-party procurement transactions. Actioned by management before submission.
Committee satisfied with FY2023 financial statements and Deloitte clean audit opinion. Recommended for full board adoption.
Board approved FY2023 annual financial statements unanimously. Strong performance recognised. Board directed management to progress gold refinery expansion.
Audited financial statements submitted to Ministry of Mines and Minerals Development and Ministry of Finance with board approval resolution and covering letter.
Ministry of Finance approved FY2023 financial statements. Dividend of ZMW 120,000,000 to be tabled at AGM.
FY2023 final dividend of ZMW 120,000,000 approved at AGM 2024 unanimously.
Ministry of Finance notified of dividend resolution. Payment instruction prepared for Bank of Zambia.
ZMW 120,000,000 transferred to Ministry of Finance consolidated fund account. Payment confirmed.
FY2025 budget of ZMW 2,950,000,000 prepared by finance team. Budget includes ZMW 650,000,000 for refinery Phase 2 capex and ZMW 480,000,000 for ASM formalisation programme.
CEO reviewed and endorsed budget. Requested reallocation of ZMW 20,000,000 from administrative to operations to strengthen buying centre staffing.
Board approved FY2025 budget of ZMW 2,950,000,000 at Q1 2025 board meeting. One board member voted against citing concerns about refinery capex phasing. Budget effective immediately.
